Posts.Content: Good luck with rads. Use the creams every day but not 2/3 hours before rads. Sparkle
Posts.Title: Finally started rads today

Posts.Content: This is my second bout with BC.  First surgery on the right breast 7 years ago.  I STILL have what feels like a lump to me, but every year after my mammograph I ask and they tell me it is scar tissue.  I am an Africian American Women and they say we kelo easier and scar tissue takes a long time to go away, if ever.  I had my second surgery on the left breast on April 26 and the scar tissue has almost gone away.  I had different surgeons and maybe one was more skilled than the other.  Try not to worry about it too much but keep asking every chance you get and every doctor you see.  Early detection right!   I'm waiting on the results of my oncotype test to help decide if I need chemo this time around.  If not, I will get 20 rounds of radiation starting the 3rd week of this month.  The waiting for all the test results is stressing me out.  I have some anxiety about  radiation on the left side so close to the heart.  The radiation oncologist said we have to be very careful but they can position me on the table so that they can avoid radiating any of the heart tissues.  Have anyone had discussions on radiation and the heart?
Posts.Title: Radiation necrosis concern

Posts.Content: Meena, I'm sorry I missed this too, but so glad it put a smile on your face. You're such an inspiration to us all. Sparkle
Posts.Title: A big Thank You!!!!

Posts.Content: Thank you for replying.  I have been so worried about this.  Also still waiting on the oncotype test to come back.  FRUSTRATED!!!
Posts.Title: Radiation necrosis concern

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, Well after 7 years I'm back again!  This is not a recurrence, it a new breast cancer on the left breast this time.  I had surgery, chemo and radiation the first time around on the right breast, then took meds. for 5 years.  I so thought this was over!!! Well, I had surgery on April 26, 2017 on the left breast and according to my surgeon, the surgery was a success.  However, he is still recommending chemo and radiation.  I see the medical oncologist next Tuesday to get her recommendation. This first time around I communicated with people from this site and it was very helpful so I'm here asking for your help once. again.  I'm feeling very overwhelmed and a bit scared.  Can I do this again?  I'm almost 60 years old; OK 59 1/2.   Signed, Here we go again
Posts.Title: Back Again

Posts.Content: Sorry for your lost. My prayers are with you and your sister's family. God Bless! Sparkle

Posts.Title: Today is CanoeGirl's Birthday!

Posts.Content: My doctor told me I should take the Tamoxifen for 5 years. My question is do you begin taking Tamoxifen after chemo or after chemo and radiation. Can you take Tamoxifen and radiation at the same time. Sparkle

Posts.Content: I have my 3rd treatment next week and they have all being OK. Hope you experience is the same. Have a great weekend. Relax.

Posts.Content: Great News for a Great Lady. So much to be thankful for. Have a great vacation. Live it up!! Sparkle
Posts.Title: And the News Just Gets Better

Posts.Content: Yes my doctor wanted me to have one before I started Arimidex. It came back normal. She said she wanted to keep an eye on it because one of the side effects of arimidex is bone loss.
Posts.Title: Muscle Girls... was a Bone Density Test recommended for You?

Posts.Content: I just finish chemo with taxotere and cytoxan. My hair fell out around the 2nd treatment. I've had minimum nausea. Make sure she drinks plenty of water and I also drank the ensure. The day after chemo I had the Neulasta shot which makes your bones ache for a few days but advil relieved the pain. One accident happened that the taxotere leaked from the IV on to my skin (wrist area) which caused a chemical burn that I am still dealing with almost 2 months later. I will keep your family in my prayers Sparkle
